          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White should politely suggest that they go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we go to The Golden Fleece instead? They have great beer and lots of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece sounds great!"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game. We're going there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly William Jones and Jack Taylor.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to meet friends at a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy, what should Alexander White do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alexander White should send a text message to William Jones to confirm if he is going to the pub and suggest meeting there.
          Question: Given the past actions, what should Alexander White do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alexander White should head to The Golden Fleece, as that is where his friends decided to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Red Lion

          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a social person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially during sporting events.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece sounds great!"

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub and hopes to see some friends there. He is looking forward to sharing the experience and celebrating a potential win with them.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a social person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially during sporting events.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a game with friends.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Jack Taylor do next in this situation?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should send a message to Alexander White and Jacob Walker, suggesting they meet at The Red Lion to watch the game.

          Question: Given the past actions, what should Jack Taylor do next in this situation?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should head to The Red Lion.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (a)

Jack Taylor just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly William Jones and Jack Taylor.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece sounds great!"
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly William Jones and Jack Taylor.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White should send a text message to William Jones to confirm if he is going to the pub and suggest meeting there.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White should head to The Golden Fleece, as that is where his friends decided to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy the company of friends like William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly William Jones and Jack Taylor.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to go with.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Alexander White do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alexander White should text William Jones to confirm if he is going to the pub and suggest meeting there.

          Question: Given the past actions, what should Alexander White do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alexander White should suggest The Golden Fleece to his friends again, emphasizing the enjoyable atmosphere and good beer.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece sounds great!"
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly William Jones and Jack Taylor.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White should send a text message to William Jones to confirm if he is going to the pub and suggest meeting there.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White should head to The Golden Fleece, as that is where his friends decided to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is, then.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout. Great beer and a fun atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly William Jones and Jack Taylor.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about we go to The Golden Fleece? They have great beer and it's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy catching the game at The Red Lion tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White should suggest The Golden Fleece to his friends again, emphasizing the enjoyable atmosphere and good beer.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White should suggest The Golden Fleece to his friends, emphasizing the enjoyable atmosphere and good beer.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

          Final chain of thought

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is fun and social, perfect for meeting new people and enjoying games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and imaginative person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and imaginative person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and imaginative person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is going to watch a game at a pub and would especially like Alexander White to join her.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and imaginative person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to go watch a game and who to invite.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Alice Lewis do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should text Alexander White to invite him to the pub to watch the game.

          Question: Given the past actions, what should Alice Lewis do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should text Jacob Walker to see if he wants to go to the pub.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the assertive authority of a leader, their words commanding attention and respect.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy and introverted person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the game at a pub with his friends, hoping to see William Jones and Alice Lewis in particular. He is less concerned about seeing Alexander White or Jack Taylor.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently feeling lonely despite looking forward to meeting his friends at the pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely feel overwhelmed and struggle to participate, perhaps retreating into himself or finding excuses to leave.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Red Lion

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely feel overwhelmed and struggle to participate, perhaps retreating into himself or finding excuses to leave.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is, then.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely feel overwhelmed and struggle to participate.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout. Great beer and a fun atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy catching the game at The Red Lion tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about we go to The Golden Fleece? They have great beer and it's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a shy and introverted person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy and introverted person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Red Lion

          Statements:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, were huddled around a table at The Red Lion, their laughter echoing through the cozy pub. A group of men from a rival factory had entered, their boisterous behavior and crude jokes grating on William's nerves. As the taunts escalated, William, fueled by a potent mix of ale and anger, rose from his seat, his fists clenched. A brawl ensued, a chaotic tangle of limbs and shouted threats, ending only when the pub owner intervened, his face grim. William, bruised but triumphant, returned to his seat, a strange sense of exhilaration coursing through him.

        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at the pub, particularly with friends like Alexander White and Jacob Walker. They are less concerned about the presence of Alice Lewis or Jack Taylor.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Red Lion to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Red Lion.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (a)

William Jones just arrived.', '[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about we go to The Golden Fleece? They have great beer and it\'s always a good time there.', "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.", '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.", '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.', "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck."]

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching games at the pub, particularly with friends like Alexander White and Jacob Walker. They are less concerned about the presence of Alice Lewis or Jack Taylor.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Red Lion to watch the game tonight?

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game. We're going there.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Answer: William Jones could go to The Red Lion to watch the game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.

      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': 'The Red Lion', 'Alice Lewis': 'The Golden Fleece', 'Alexander White': 'The Golden Fleece', 'Jack Taylor': 'The Red Lion', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Red Lion'}

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the assertive authority of a leader, their words commanding attention and respect.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy and introverted person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling lonely and hopes to connect with Alice Lewis at the game. He also sees it as an opportunity to bond with William Jones and Jack Taylor.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is hoping to connect with his friends, particularly Alice Lewis, at a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely feel a mix of excitement and nervousness, hoping to enjoy the game with friends but potentially struggling with social interaction.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Red Lion
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?

        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely feel overwhelmed and struggle to participate.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is, then.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely feel overwhelmed and struggle to participate, perhaps retreating into himself or finding excuses to leave.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a shy and introverted person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy and introverted person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a social person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly during sporting events.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to meet his friends at a pub to watch a game.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Jack Taylor do next in this situation?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should suggest to his friends that they all meet at The Red Lion to watch the game together.

          Question: Given the past actions, what should Jack Taylor do next in this situation?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should suggest to his friends that they all meet at The Red Lion to watch the game together.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (a)

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor should head to The Red Lion.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion's the place to be for the game tonight, right?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game. We're going there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor should ask his friends where they plan to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a social person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially during sporting events.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor should engage in conversation with his friends, potentially suggesting they watch the game together.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a social person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly during sporting events.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to meet his friends at a pub to watch a game.

          Answer: Jack Taylor should suggest to his friends that they all meet at The Red Lion to watch the game together.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about we go to The Golden Fleece? They have great beer and it's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout. Great beer and a fun atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is, then.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy catching the game at The Red Lion tonight?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game. We're going there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion's the place to be for the game tonight, right?"
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at the pub with friends, particularly Jacob Walker and Alexander White. He is hoping to see them at The Red Lion for tonight's game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Red Lion and hope his friends will join him.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Red Lion

      Name

    • The Red Lion
